page.title: 11FARMING-1. GENERAL
page.content:
If you looked down from the sky or from a plane onto this area you would see mainly fields,most of which are green,but some are yellow.The green is grass,or not yet ripened wheat,oats or barley.The yellow fields contain oil seed rape or ripe wheat,oats or barley.
As well as the fields,a bird's-eye view would show that within the area are several woods;Croft Wood,Dicky Wood,Wild Wood,Thackmire Ash Wood, Church Hill Wood,Conyers Spring Wood, and Aikbargill Plantation.Some of these woods belong to the Forestry Commission but some belong to the Wyvill estate.The wood,which is used for firewood and Christmas trees,is a mixture of both coniferous and deciduous trees.
